entry.title: Growing Together, Hand in Hand
entry.summary:
Author: Idachen

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 97,687Chapters: 28/29Kudos: 314

Summary: Buck 1.0 was impulsive, wildly charismatic, and, let’s be honest, extremely sexually active. Everyone knew that.What no one really knew, though, was that Buck had always been that way—well, at least since Maddie had left. Not since he was twelve, obviously, but by the time he was fourteen, he'd had his first time, and by sophomore year, he’d already hooked up with about half of his grade and a good third of the grade below.And this is important to understand. Because if you don’t get that about Buck, it won’t make much sense why what happened next wasn’t really all that surprising.orA crazy story in which Buck first finds out how he can take care of his daughter who shows up at his place from one day to the next and later how he can become a family with his new handsome neighbor, who also seems to be his colleague, and his adorable child.Sequel: Allie tries to figure out in which ways her mother is still haunting her and what she can do about it. At the same time her parents get their tendency back to hurt themselves, which is why she tries everything she can to hold the rest of her siblings together.

Summary: Buck thought he knew what rock bottom felt like already. Not just any regular ticket. No. A whole weekend getaway, the premium pack with a fancy restaurant booking and SPA included.This. entry.title: old old fashioned (i hope we kiss goodnight)
entry.summary:
Author: bleakmonday

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,610Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 67

Summary: Buck donates his sperm the old-fashioned way.Eddie, of course, is totally 100% absolutely normal about it.---“So have they explained the process to you? The clinics and the calendars? How long your sperm is viable before it can’t be used? Or are you just gonna hand it over and let them freeze it until it works?” She asks, genuinely interested in the topic despite the fact that she’s talking about Buck’s jizz.The question makes everyone silent again, Ravi looking curious about the topic, because he’s curious about most topics, bless him.Buck closes his eyes and clenches them shut. “Um. No, we didn’t really… get a chance to talk about that stuff yet…” He trails off and hopes they all let it drop.Hen doesn’t, because of course she doesn’t. She now has a clinical and professional interest in the subject as a (hopefully) future doctor. “You didn’t get a chance? What the hell else would you have been talking about?”Buck takes a deep breath and rips the (waterproof, extra-durable) adhesive bandage off. “We just went ahead and tried it the old-fashioned way.”

entry.title: Keep Me (In the Pocket of your Jeans)
entry.summary:
Author: Pxrpls

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 95,191Chapters: 15/?Kudos: 363

Summary: That’s his problem. Buck always manages to make the calls personal, even if they are so far behind his realm of reality. He always makes them about himself, he had been told this way too many times already. And he’s trying to change, he really is. But then there are moments like these in which a little girl needs saving and Buck blurs the line between what’s his job and his own need to be there for everyone he meets. His need to fix everything.   So he stays there, just for that first surgery he keeps reminding himself, just to make sure she makes it out of the ER. Just to make sure Hen is right and she is in good hands. And a few hours later, when she makes it out and the doctor’s look around the waiting room for Cassie’s parents without all the context Buck already has, he stands up. On instinct. Barely even a lie. He couldn’t count it as one when he hadn’t spoken at all. He just stands up. He stands up and he follows the doctor to the ICU. In which Buck worries about the little girl he just saved from a fire, and he gives her a home in his arms.

entry.title: The One Left Behind
entry.summary:
Author: FireNationQueen

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,781Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 130

Summary: They found Buck in the rubble, broken and barely breathing.What follows isn’t just a fight for his life—it’s a reckoning. With pain he never voiced. With love he didn’t know how to accept. With the people who refuse to let him go.Eddie never leaves his side. Bobby steps into the space a father should have filled. Athena holds them all steady while the rest of the 118 tries to hold onto hope. Maddie is terrified. Christopher is too far away. And Buck—Buck is somewhere between the wreckage and the light, trying to find his way back.
